title: Ticket #2154: SMTP_DOMAIN - Replace UID_DOMAIN as source of notification emails
description:
When sending notification emails we try sending it to Owner@$(UID_DOMAIN), or if UID_DOMAIN isn't set Owner@($FULL_HOSTNAME) (where Owner is the Owner of the job). This works well for most cases, but sometime the UID_DOMAIN won't be the same as the domain where mail should be routed. For example, I might have

UID_DOMAIN=cluster.example.com

to distinguish it from another computer pool that is just

UID_DOMAIN=example.com

but email should still go to example.com, not cluster.example.com. (condor-admin 22129 is such a case). Of course, administrators would need to be careful to ensure that any username valid inside of cluster.example.com is still valid @example.com, but that is reasonable.

Current workaround: users must remember to set "notify_user=adesmet@example.com".

Proposal: Add SMTP_DOMAIN or perhaps EMAIL_DOMAIN, as a known setting. If present, Owner@$(EMAIL_DOMAIN) will be used in preference to UID_DOMAIN or FULL_HOSTNAME.
